top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

Most hotel doors swing inwards. A wood or hard rubber door stop will do the same thing as a door brace and is very easy to pack. If the door doesn't allow for a door stop, a chair under the doorknob can do a similar job.

Sadly, I heard about door stops because of active shooter drills.
Not so fun fact: the majority of locks that are originally installed in homes have pretty much no strength and thus, barely any protection.
And if they would bust down a door they wouldn’t break a window?

Better suggestion would be, don’t get black out drunk while travelling and don’t bring strangers back to your room. Odds of a rando breaking into your hotel room have to be infinitesimally small. Odds of the former bringing about violence, much higher
